Text: We must be clear, anything less than a pure warrant requirement for any search on American persons in the 702 database is a failure of this body to protect the Constitutional rights of American citizens.
The ideals that were born in this country are now are weaker here than in other areas of the world.
In recent years the perception around the world is that the US is no longer the leader in privacy.
Now our privacy will be denied by the fact that these warrantless searches will continue.
FISA was created to go after Foreign Agents and terrorists, not Americans.
Anything less than a full 4th amendment warrant requirement based on probable cause means that the continual, warrantless spying on American Citizens will be permitted to continue.

The House Intelligence Committee’s decision to move on their own version of FISA legislation without adequate Constitutional protections for Americans is disturbing and creates a dangerous playing field for the future of 702.

The people of Texas need and deserve federal assistance for long-term flood mitigation, which this request does not sufficiently provide. We stand together opposed to this level of funding and will continue to fight to help Texas rebuild.

While damages are still being determined, estimates currently sit at approximately $190 billion or more. To be clear, this $44 billion proposal, to be split between multiple disaster areas, does not adequately address long-term recovery needs in Texas.
Hurricane Harvey and the subsequent flooding events that followed ranks as the second most costly disaster in modern times (the Fukushima Disaster ranks first).
We have met personally with the Director of OMB and explained in detail the disaster of Harvey on Texas. Even so, we strongly believe the request is woefully inadequate.

After reviewing the latest Office of Management and Budget (OMB) supplemental request for disaster recovery, we find the proposal insufficient and unacceptable. @RepPeteOlson @farenthold @TXRandy14 @RepBrianBabin @RepMcCaul

The passage of this legislation will help Texas with the recovery process and works to improve already existing flood protections. I urge the Senate to move quickly on this bill.

Most importantly for Houston, the legislation requires funding to be prioritized for properties that have experienced repetitive flood losses and improves mapping technology so that policies are based on more accurate information and data.

Human Trafficking is a scourge on our society and it's time to put a stop to it. And that's just the way it is.
Each year @RepJimCosta and I fight to protect the VOCA fund. We need all the help we can get to protect it.
As fathers we must take responsibility for what we teach our sons. They must learn this treatment and behavior towards women is not okay
Buyers of sex create the demand for human trafficking. We must change the conversation. We must be aware of who these people are.
Not in our city. Not in our town. Not in our society. It's time to #EndTrafficking
The conversation around human trafficking is beginning to change. I'm encouraged to see members of Congress joining the conversation.
We must work to end the demand of human trafficking. Go after the seller and the buyer. #EndTrafficking
TB to my days as Judge: I've introduced the SHAME Act allowing Judges to openly publish photographs of convicted buyers and sellers of sex.pic.twitter.com/6DvP9Y9I0g

The Justice for Victims of Trafficking Act (now law) goes after the:
Trafficker (seller)
Customer (stop the demand)
Judges must divert young trafficked victims into another system that works to recovery...not throwing them into the jailhouse.
Children cannot commit the crime of prostitution. They are a child. They cannot consent. They are a victim. NOT a "child prostitute."
Reality: victims vs criminal line is often blurred-we must separate the victims fm perpetrators. It's time to treat victims like victims.
No taxpayer dollars are spent. The fund helps victims of crime recover their lives and seek services they need. The fund grows every yr.
We must concentrate on helping victims of human trafficking. The Victims of Crime Fund (VOCA) belongs to solely to victims of crime.pic.twitter.com/jeAKxCldvo
As a Judge I saw what was happening to young women who were trafficked & knew we must take action to end this scourge on society.
